## Proposal Summary

to have a way to get the model file from GCS by using signed url

## Details
let's take a look at the current deployment view of the model development flow with MLFlow.
![mlflow-deployment](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32842826/148482528-af6b0a35-1769-4532-adfb-08a8bda369c6.png)
the picture above shows the high-level of system deployment view while ignoring several detailed components such as relational databases. Here are several important points which are related to this:
- In this context, each model service components are a completely different service. They aren't replicas.
- The VPC in yellow are the user artefacts, while the purple ones are managed by the our team.
- MLFlow service is exposed through a public API that is only accessible by other internal services. We use openresty as the proxy.
- Google Cloud Storage (GCS) doesn't lie inside the VPC. It's accessible through the internet. But, it's protected by a perimeter.

Next, let's zoom into the main use case of this system, which is to fetch models from the MLFlow service.
![mlflow-deployment (2)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32842826/148485032-145eca4d-c719-4adf-ace9-2a3d210b1d5e.png)
the picture above shows the flow of the main use case of this system. The flow happens sequentially, but each request can be parallelized. Here is the detail of the flow:
1.  MLFlow returns the GCS URL of the model, not the model itself.
2.  Next, the model service requests the file to the GCS.
3. GCS returns the requested files.

you can see the problem lies when the users need to get the model file directly to GCS. they can't do that due to the perimeter.
